alfredsnippet.snippet:
http://www.whoi.edu/news-release/dissolved-iron

"The scientific community has long thought that the vast majority of the ocean's iron comes from atmospheric dust, with smaller inputs from dissolved sediment along continental margins, and fluids from hydrothermal vents, which are mineral-rich hot springs on the seafloor, miles below the surface ...

'The ratio of iron isotopes vary among the different iron sources -- atmospheric dust, hydrothermal vents, and dissolved sediments -- and are actually quite distinct, like fingerprints ..."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Extraterrestrial Sands - Part 9
